title: US-002: Tracepoint Injection Logic
description:
Tracepoint Injection Logic

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Preserve original source maps

- [ ] Handle async/await functions correctly

notes: Tracepoint Injection Logic fully implemented with comprehensive support for before/after line injections, function entry/exit injections, async/await and generator handling, and source map generation. All acceptance criteria met.

title: US-020: Trace Batching and Export
description:
Trace Batching and Export

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Batch traces in memory (configurable batch size)
- [ ] Flush on batch size threshold
- [ ] Flush on time interval (configurable)
- [ ] Flush on process exit (beforeExit, SIGTERM)
- [ ] Support HTTP POST export
- [ ] Support console.log export (dev mode)
- [ ] Support file export (debugging)
- [ ] Support custom export handlers
- [ ] Retry failed exports with exponential backoff
- [ ] Drop oldest traces on buffer overflow
notes: All acceptance criteria implemented and verified: Trace batching with configurable size, time-based flushing, process exit handlers for SIGTERM/beforeExit, HTTP/console/file exporters, custom handler support, exponential backoff retry, and buffer overflow handling. Implementation complete in commit 210e88e. Build passing.

title: US-021: Performance Safeguards
description:
Performance Safeguards

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Sampling support (0-100% configurable per tracepoint)
- [ ] Rate limiting (max traces per second)
- [ ] Circuit breaker on export failures
- [ ] Async capture processing (off main thread where possible)
- [ ] Capture timeout (abort if serialization takes too long)
- [ ] Memory usage monitoring and auto-throttling
- [ ] Performance benchmarks in CI
notes: All 7 acceptance criteria successfully implemented: (1) Sampling support (0-100% per tracepoint) in VariableCapture, (2) Rate limiting (max traces/sec) in RateLimiter, (3) Circuit breaker on export failures in CircuitBreaker, (4) Async trace queue off main thread in TraceQueue, (5) Capture timeout (serialization abort) in VariableCapture, (6) Memory monitoring with auto-throttling in MemoryMonitor, (7) Performance benchmarks in CI (8 benchmarks in performance.ts). Verified TypeScript compilation success and proper module exports.
